title: Stuck on "Authenticating" at login screen.   July 23, 2017

replies.body:
@BROPORO

Yeah i'll be honest, it seems a little pre-mature and irresponsible to solely point the finger at the ISP, when the ONLY issue we are having is with RIOT/League. 

I am able to play all other games, and have no throttling of my internet. Speed tests are like normal. 

My SOLE issue, is the ability to play League without a VPN. Seeing how this has been pinpointed to the Midwest and potentially Comcast in specific, are you able to provide us with an update that someone from RIOT has reached out to Comcast in this area for this issue?

Or is the problem not as widespread / reported as these boards make it seem?

Best Wishes, thanks for your help.

edit:  i wanted to add that i totally understand your job is probably just a community manager and you are only able to relay what information you are given. i appreciate the help buddy.

It's a good first step that you checked out that firewall, but there might still be something blocking your network from being able to reach our servers reliably. Check out some of your [**network settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), and be sure to work through each step in that guide paying special attention to port forwarding.

This is due to how your connection is being sent to our NA servers by your ISP. When you're trying to connect to the EUW servers, your connection gets sent in a completely different path, which turns out to work a little smoother for you.

so its not a chicago issue? I just would like to know if theres anything i could do or if i just should sit tight and wait for a fix. Cause nothing on my PC has changed from when it last worked until when it didn't
For the time being, most players have been able to get back in the game by using a VPN like CyberGhost. Unfortunately, there's not much more I can offer until this ISP issue gets straightened out.
So we have to fix it by our own ?
Another Chicago region account here, struggling with the same issues and not having luck with anything :/

> [{quoted}](name=F6 Tornado,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=PacjOQZO,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-07-24T00:58:13.235+0000)
>
> I think this is problem on Riot's end affecting those of us in Illinois, Indiana, and Michigan. I am able to connect to EUW servers but not NA. I have tried on different computer on same network with no success.

I agree with this individual. I just logged into my EUW account no issues. This is indeed a Chicago server issue in my opinion.

UPDATE: I tried all of the options on the support page you linked including the port forward guide. I'm used to port forwarding so doing that was simple. I opened all the needed ports and used a port checker to ensure that it was done correctly. Still no results.
Love how I've had a post online since 10ish this morning and got no rioters help, but this post gets replied to within an hour. FeelsGoodMan
NWI member here, same issue for me too. Nothing ive done seems to be working. Tried going through the network settings, used the hextech repair tool, even deleted then reinstalled. Nothing works
Indiana Region here and i have comcast and Ive had this issue for three days now. Ive tried using vpn and it didnt work

UPDATE FROM THE NEXT DAY: 

I don't know if anything was done by Riot or by Comcast but I am able to login into League without any issues. I hope that the issue has been resolved for the rest of you that posted to this thread as well.

If you guys check my post you'll see that this has been happening all day to people around the Chicagoland area since about 4 am CST. All we can do now is just hope that riot will fix this problem and we can all go back to having less than 30 ping :)

I wanted to say i'm from the Chicago region and am experiencing the same issues. 
Have tried all listed fixes.
Issues just started today, played fine yesterday. Nothing installed/changed since then.
Update: Restarted my PC as well as restarted my internet modem, still no change.
